intro: Callirhoe alcaeoides, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. Callirhoe alcaeoides is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
